<span class="n">basedir</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">os</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">path</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">join</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">os</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">getcwd</span><span class="p">(),</span> <span class="s1">'polychord'</span><span class="p">)</span>  <span class="c1"># output base directory</span>
<span class="k">if</span> <span class="ow">not</span> <span class="n">os</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">path</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isdir</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">basedir</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">os</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">makedirs</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">basedir</span><span class="p">)</span>                          <span class="c1"># create base directory</span>
    <span class="n">os</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">makedirs</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">os</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">path</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">join</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">basedir</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'clusters'</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">fileroot</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'straightline'</span>                         <span class="c1"># output file name</span>
<span class="n">broot</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">os</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">path</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">join</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">basedir</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fileroot</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># import PolyChord</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pypolychord</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">pypolychord.settings</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">PolyChordSettings</span>  <span class="c1"># class for passing setup information</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">pypolychord.priors</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">UniformPrior</span>         <span class="c1"># pre-defined class for a uniform prior</span>

<span class="c1"># setup run settings using the PolyChordSetting class</span>
<span class="n">pargs</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'nlive'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">nlive</span><span class="p">,</span>
         <span class="s1">'precision_criterion'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">tol</span><span class="p">,</span>
         <span class="s1">'base_dir'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">basedir</span><span class="p">,</span>
         <span class="s1">'file_root'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">fileroot</span><span class="p">,</span>
         <span class="s1">'write_resume'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="c1"># don't output a resume file</span>
         <span class="s1">'read_resume'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">}</span>  <span class="c1"># don't read a resume file</span>
<span class="n">settings</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">PolyChordSettings</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ndims</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">nderived</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="o">**</span><span class="n">pargs</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">t0</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">output</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pypolychord</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">run_polychord</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">loglikelihood_polychord</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ndims</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">nderived</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">settings</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">prior_transform_polychord</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">t1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="n">timepolychord</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t1</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">t0</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Time taken to run 'PyPolyChord' is </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2"> seconds"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">timepolychord</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="c1"># reset stack resource limit</span>
<span class="n">resource</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">setrlimit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">resource</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">RLIMIT_STACK</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">curlimit</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Time taken to run 'PyPolyChord' is 14.819834232330322 seconds
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can extract the marginal likelihood and the uncertainty from the <code>output</code> variable.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[76]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">six</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">u</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'log(Z) = </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1"> </span><span class="se">\u00B1</span><span class="s1"> </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">output</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">logZ</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">output</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">logZerr</span><span class="p">)))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>log(Z) = -87.8126079337254  0.101820963323386
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can also extract the posterior samples from the file with the <code>_equal_weights.txt</code> suffix. Given we have two parameters, the chains for these will be the final two columns within the samples file.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[77]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">samplefile</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">broot</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="s1">'_equal_weights.txt'</span>
<span class="n">samples_polychord</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">loadtxt</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samplefile</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">samples_polychord</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">samples_polychord</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">ndims</span><span class="p">:]</span> <span class="c1"># extract the last 'ndims' columns</span>

<span class="c1"># print out the number of posterior samples</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Number of posterior samples is </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_polychord</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]))</span>

<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'mpolychord_mu'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_polychord</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># mean of m samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'mpolychord_sig'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_polychord</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># standard deviation of m samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'cpolychord_mu'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_polychord</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># mean of c samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'cpolychord_sig'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_polychord</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># standard deviation of c samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ccpolychord'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">corrcoef</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_polychord</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># correlation coefficient between parameters</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'polychord_npos'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_polychord</span><span class="p">)</span>              <span class="c1"># number of posterior samples</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'polychord_time'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">timepolychord</span>                       <span class="c1"># run time</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'polychord_logZ'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">output</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">logZ</span>                         <span class="c1"># log marginalised likelihood</span>
<span class="n">resdict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'polychord_logZerr'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">output</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">logZerr</span>                   <span class="c1"># uncertainty on log(Z)</span>

<span class="c1"># plot using corner.py</span>
<span class="n">plotposts</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">samples_polychord</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

<h2 id="Summary">Summary<a class="anchor-link" href="#Summary"></a></h2><p>The timings given in this notebook are not directly comparable as the various codes have not been run with identical settings, and the number of likelihood evaluations produced can be quite different. But, they may be helpful in providing a rough ball-park of expected run times. As mentioned in relation to <a href="#emcee">emcee above</a>, it is important to note that different samplers will produce different numbers of truly independent samples, so some methods that may take longer to run may actually give more independent samples. It is also worth noting that some of the codes can make use or multiple CPU cores, or GPUs, but these have not been used here. So, speed-ups could be achieved by using these in-built parallelisations.</p>
<p>The number of posterior samples produced by the nested sampling codes can depend strongly on the number of initial live points used. However, for the codes where we have specified a number of live points the final posterior sizes are very comparable. It should be noted that comparing posterior sample sizes and run times for DNest4 in particular is not entirely fair, as it is designed with more complex problems in mind and is not created to be efficient at simple examples where other methods work easily.</p>
<p>Now let's overplot everything (it will look a bit horrific)!</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[78]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.pyplot</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">cm</span> 
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.colors</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">to_hex</span>

<span class="c1"># get a list of all the samples</span>
<span class="n">chains</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">samples_emcee</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">samples_pymc3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">samples_edward</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">samples_pystan</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">samples_pyjags</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">samples_nestle</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">samples_cpnest</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">samples_dynesty</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">samples_ultranest</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">samples_pymnest</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">samples_dnest4</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">samples_polychord</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">cm</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">gnuplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">linspace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">chains</span><span class="p">)))</span>

<span class="n">hist2dkwargs</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'plot_datapoints'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">,</span>
                <span class="s1">'plot_density'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">,</span>
                <span class="s1">'levels'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mf">1.0</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">0.5</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">arange</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mf">1.5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">2.1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">**</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)}</span> <span class="c1"># roughly 1 and 2 sigma</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">chain</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">enumerate</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">chains</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">cv</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">to_hex</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">color</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">])</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">fig</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">corner</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">corner</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">chain</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">labels</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="sa">r</span><span class="s2">"$m$"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="sa">r</span><span class="s2">"$c$"</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">cv</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">hist_kwargs</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'density'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="o">**</span><span class="n">hist2dkwargs</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="o"><</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">chains</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">corner</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">corner</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">chain</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">labels</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="sa">r</span><span class="s2">"$m$"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="sa">r</span><span class="s2">"$c$"</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">fig</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">cv</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">hist_kwargs</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'density'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="o">**</span><span class="n">hist2dkwargs</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="c1"># plot true values on last plot</span>
            <span class="n">corner</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">corner</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">chain</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">labels</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="sa">r</span><span class="s2">"$m$"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="sa">r</span><span class="s2">"$c$"</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">truths</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">m</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">c</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">fig</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">cv</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">hist_kwargs</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'density'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="o">**</span><span class="n">hist2dkwargs</span><span class="p">)</span>
            
<span class="n">fig</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_size_inches</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mf">10.0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">9.0</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

<span class="n">outputtable</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">six</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">u</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"""</span>

<span class="s2">| CPNest | </span><span class="si">{mcpnest_mu:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="se">\u00B1</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="si">{mcpnest_sig:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> | </span><span class="si">{ccpnest_mu:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="se">\u00B1</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="si">{ccpnest_sig:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> | </span><span class="si">{cccpnest:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> |</span>
<span class="s2">| dynesty | </span><span class="si">{mdynesty_mu:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="se">\u00B1</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="si">{mdynesty_sig:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> | </span><span class="si">{cdynesty_mu:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="se">\u00B1</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="si">{cdynesty_sig:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> | </span><span class="si">{ccdynesty:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> |</span>
<span class="s2">| UltraNest | </span><span class="si">{multranest_mu:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="se">\u00B1</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="si">{multranest_sig:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> | </span><span class="si">{cultranest_mu:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="se">\u00B1</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="si">{cultranest_sig:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> | </span><span class="si">{ccultranest:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> |</span>
<span class="s2">| PyMultiNest | </span><span class="si">{mpymnest_mu:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="se">\u00B1</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="si">{mpymnest_sig:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> | </span><span class="si">{cpymnest_mu:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="se">\u00B1</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="si">{cpymnest_sig:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> | </span><span class="si">{ccpymnest:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> |</span>
<span class="s2">| DNest4 | </span><span class="si">{mdnest4_mu:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="se">\u00B1</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="si">{mdnest4_sig:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> | </span><span class="si">{cdnest4_mu:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="se">\u00B1</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="si">{cdnest4_sig:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> | </span><span class="si">{ccdnest4:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> |</span>
<span class="s2">| PyPolyChord | </span><span class="si">{mpolychord_mu:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="se">\u00B1</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="si">{mpolychord_sig:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> | </span><span class="si">{cpolychord_mu:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="se">\u00B1</span><span class="s2"> </span><span class="si">{cpolychord_sig:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> | </span><span class="si">{ccpolychord:.3f}</span><span class="s2"> |</span>
<span class="s2">"""</span><span class="p">)</span>
